case_vignette: An African-American man, aged 35 years, presents with a 3-month history of pruritic penile lesions. Examination reveals an arcuate pattern of raised violaceous-to-flesh-colored papules with central clearing on the glans penis and a few scattered, raised violaceous-to-flesh-colored polygonal papules of the glans penis and distal penile shaft. Results of the remainder of the skin examination are normal, and there is no inguinal lymphadenopathy. His sexual history includes no previous sexually transmitted diseases and no new sexual partners within the past year.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I've been experiencing itchy spots on my penis for the past three months.
Have you noticed any discharge or pain in the affected area?
No, there's no discharge or pain, just itchiness.
Have you had any recent changes in your sexual activity or hygiene habits?
No, nothing's changed; I haven't had any new sexual partners in the past year and no previous sexually transmitted diseases.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, fatigue, or joint pain?
No, I haven't noticed any other symptoms like fever, fatigue, or joint pain.
Have you had any family history of similar symptoms?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
Have you noticed any changes in your diet or lifestyle habits?
I haven't mentioned any recent changes in my diet or lifestyle habits.
Have you noticed any changes in your stress levels or sleep patterns?
I haven't talked about any changes in my stress levels or sleep patterns.
Have you noticed any changes in your weight or body composition?
No, I haven't mentioned any changes in my weight or body composition.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin color or texture?
Yes, there are raised spots that are purple to skin-colored on my penis with some clear centers.
Final Diagnosis: Genital Warts.
